item.title: Functional_1
item.description: Create a function In JavaScript you can create functions in 2 ways: by Function Declaration as Function Expressions Function Declarations C-style syntax function declarations are used to create named functions. These functions can be called using their declared name. // JS Function Declaration function twoFold(num) { return 2 * num; } A similar syntax is also used, for instance, in Python # Python Function Declaration def twoFold(num): return 2 * num or in MATLAB, except that, in this case, the returned value must also be indicated to the left of the = symbol in function declaration (the return keyword has a different usage here).
